Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL ?; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Necklace plaquettes
Description: The two necklace plaquettes, of which the provenance is not known, show an openwork decoration figuring spirals. The motif is originally from the island of Crete, but the production is surely egyptian. The pieces, which are provided with a suspension ring, date from the New Kingdom.
